definition[0]: when someone gets money from another person by using threats
definition[1]: a thorough search of a place or a person
example[1]: No weapons were found during the shakedown.
definition[2]: a period of time when people start to get used to a new arrangement and it becomes more effective
definition[3]: a period of time when prices are falling on a financial market
definition[4]: a final test of a boat, plane etc before it is put into general use
example[2]: The new system is in its shakedown phase.
example[3]: The company is expected to enter its final shakedown phase by the middle of September.
example[4]: The shakedown in engineering shares seems to be nearly over, with only minor declines yesterday.
definition[5]: the process of getting money from someone, using threats
example[5]: He had banked $25,000 in one day from the shakedown of bucket-shop proprietors, shady dealers in the stock market.
